attributes.action: Supermarkets to provide staff with protective equipment during COVID-19 pandemic
attributes.additional_details: People working in supermarkets are at high risk of contracting the COVID-19 coronavirus as they have to come into close contact with hundreds of members of the public on a daily basis. Often the customers they deal with are upset (especially with stock limitations and item restrictions) and will shout at staff in a way that's bound to spread germs. Providing equipment for these key workers will help the government in reducing the spread of the virus.
attributes.background: Supermarkets should be required to provide staff members with protective equipment such as gloves, aprons, masks and screens at checkouts in order to protect them from contracting the coronavirus.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305874

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
